name: XO-7
scenarioDescription:
The XO-7 Exoplanetary System


Overview

XO-7 is a star with 1.41 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.48 times its radius. It is located 763.5311959999999 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.18 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

XO-7 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the XO-7 system

XO-7 b

XO-7 b was discovered by the XO observatory using the Transit method. The mass of XO-7 b is 225.34147 times the mass of Earth. The radius of XO-7 b is 15.39 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, XO-7 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, XO-7 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system XO-7, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by XO.
